title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Special Education Teachers

content.rendered:
What is a Special Education Teacher?

Special Education Teachers are educators who specialize in working with children and youths who have disabilities.

Where does a Special Education Teacher work?

  • Preschools
  • High schools
  • Residential facilities

How much does a Special Education Teacher make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Special Education Teacher is $40,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Special Education Teachers?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Education majors
  • Psychology majors 
  • English majors
Search Special Education Teacher jobs on Handshake

Special Education Teacher skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Special Education Teachers succeed in their work:

  • Dedication and compassion for your students
  • Ability to adjust to their students
  • Ability to create and execute lesson plans

What are some common questions about Special Education Teachers?

Q: What education does a Special Education Teacher need?

A: Most special education instructors will be required to have at least a bachelor’s degree in an education related field. Also, many employers will require that you have a teaching license as well.
